Description: Body sherd of Rhodian pottery Vroulia cup, probably a cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; part of incised whirligig with added red on alternate segments; exterior glazed black with trace of reserved zone at top of sherd with red band below; top of possible incised upright palmette with red on leaves; double scalloped line at top of palmette.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the whirligig, see Kinch 1914, 179, fig. 61b, which belongs to a cup that falls within Kinch's Group B 2.β.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.18) (phase 3)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 163)
